title: 108_hr3514
content: The "Pennsylvania National Forest Improvement Act of 2004" includes provisions for the disposal and conveyance of various administrative sites within the Allegheny National Forest in Pennsylvania. This Act also addresses the administration of land acquired by the United States and its relation to other conveyance authorities. The Secretary of Agriculture has the authority to sell or exchange National Forest System lands and administrative sites in the Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania. This includes specific tracts such as US Tract 121, Sheffield ranger residence (0.41 acres), US Tract 896, undeveloped administrative site (2.42 acres), and US Tract 1047, original Marienville Ranger District Headquarters (4.90 acres). The maps referred to in subsection (a) are the primary descriptions of the lands to which they refer, with the map being the definitive description unless it cannot be located. The maps will be available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. (c) Consideration for conveyance of land under subsection (a) may include exchanging other land or making cash equalization payments. Any land conveyance is subject to laws and regulations for the National Forest System. The Secretary may give preference to public entities for land conveyance for public purposes. Offers can be solicited with specified terms and conditions, and offers may be rejected if deemed inadequate or not in the public interest. Upon conveyance of land, any public order withdrawing the land is revoked. The Secretary may impose additional terms and conditions on land conveyances to protect U.S. interests. The Sheffield Ranger District headquarters in Warren County, Pennsylvania will be conveyed. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 770, Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, consisting of 5.50 acres, to the Warren County Development Association for a lump sum payment of $100,000. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Elk Tanning Company Tract 770, 1934" serves as the primary description of the lands. The map will be available for public inspection in the Office of the Chief of the Forest Service until the lands are disposed of. Upon conveyance of land by the Secretary, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. SEC. 4. CONVEYANCE OF RIDGEWAY RANGER DISTRICT HEADQUARTERS, ELK COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township, Pennsylvania, for fair market value as determined by an appraisal. The maps serve as the primary description of the lands being conveyed. In case of conflict between map and metes and bounds descriptions, the map is the definitive description unless it cannot be located. Maps are available for public inspection until lands are disposed of. Upon land conveyance by the Secretary, any public order withdrawing the land is revoked. SEC. 5. CONVEYANCE OF MARIENVILLE RANGER RESIDENCE, FOREST COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey, without consideration, to the Marienville Volunteer Fire Department of Forest County, Pennsylvania, all right, title, and interest of the United States in a portion of US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Peter B. DeSmet Tract 844, 1936" identifies the area as Lot 2 on the Survey Plat prepared by D. M. Heller on December 12, 1999. The map serves as the primary description of the lands, and in case of conflict with metes and bounds description, the map prevails unless it cannot be located. The map is available for public inspection in the Office of the Chief of the Forest Service until the lands are disposed. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey land to the Marienville Volunteer Fire Department of Forest County, Pennsylvania. Upon conveyance, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey land to the Marienville Volunteer Fire Department of Forest County, Pennsylvania, revoking any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws. The Secretary of Agriculture shall deposit proceeds from sales and exchanges in the Sisk Act Fund for the Allegheny National Forest. These funds can be used for administrative facilities, site improvements, and land acquisition within the forest, subject to certain conditions. The Secretary of Agriculture can use proceeds from sales and exchanges in the Sisk Act Fund for the Allegheny National Forest for administrative facilities, site improvements, and land acquisition, with the condition that the market value of acquired lands does not exceed 125 percent of the market value of lands disposed of under this Act. SEC. 7. Lands acquired by the Secretary of Agriculture under section 6(b) or by exchange shall be managed in accordance with the Weeks Act and other laws pertaining to National Forest System lands. The boundaries of the Allegheny National Forest will be adjusted based on land disposal and acquisition under this Act. SEC. 8. Relation to other conveyances authorities. SEC. 8. RELATION TO OTHER CONVEYANCES AUTHORITIES. Lands authorized for disposal under this Act shall not be subject to certain provisions of title 40, United States Code.
